org.haldean.chopper.server
Class GraphComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              org.haldean.chopper.server.GraphComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class GraphComponent
extends javax.swing.JComponent

A class which draws a graph based on a series of given result sets. The graph automatically scales along the Y axis and can be manually scaled along the X axis.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

setMax

public void setMax(double _max)
Manually set the maximum. Note that if a data point larger than this maximum is added, the graph will automatically scale. This sets a lower bound on the actual maximum of the graph.

Parameters:
_max - The lower bound for the maximum

setMin

public void setMin(double _min)
Manually set the minimum. Note that if a data point smaller than this minimum is added, the graph will automatically scale. This sets an upper bound on the actual minimum of the graph.

Parameters:
_min - The upper bound for the minimum

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String _name)
Set the name of the graph

Overrides:
setName in class java.awt.Component

setSampleCount

public void setSampleCount(int _sampleCount)
Set the scale along the X axis.

Parameters:
_sampleCount - The number of samples shown along the X axis. The graph will automatically adjust to show the most recent _sampleCount samples.

addPoint

public void addPoint(double p)
Add a sample to the graph.

Parameters:
p - The Y-value of the sample to add

pointToY

public int pointToY(double p)
Convert a value to a canvas pixel location

Parameters:
p - The sample value
Returns:
The pixel Y corresponding to that sample value

pointToX

public int pointToX(int x)
Convert a time-index to a canvas pixel location

Parameters:
x - The time index
Returns:
The pixel X corresponding to that time index

main

Test code: draw an amplifying sine wave. Run this. It's mesmerizing.
